title: Rapid bacterial Virulence Annotation for the post genomic era
findingsText: We developed a series of simple genomic screens for gain of function annotation of bacterial clones. We used screens against other bacteria, insects, nematodes and both insect and mammalian cells to isolate regions of the Photorhabdus genome involved in both symbiosis and pathogenesis. The screen against macrophages can be used in screens for vaccine candidates. We have filed a US patent on the use of this technology to screen bacterial genomes for vaccine candidates.
